method.name: GET
method.id: Initialize MAC One-time Password Authentication API for Delivery Selection
method.doc: The MAC OTP mechanisms must be correctly configured before the policy workflow can successfully respond to any runtime requests. Information about its configuration is available under the Configuring Authentication topics of the IBM Knowledge Center.

This authentication policy is a little different to the other authentication policies. The MAC OTP policy supports the concepts of SELECT, GENERATE AND DELIVER, VERIFY. It enables this for each of the supported MAC OTP mechanisms. The policy can be initialized in one of two ways:
1. With HTTP GET which corresponds to SELECT'ing from the available delivery methods.
2. With HTTP POST which corresponds to GENERATE AND DELIVER using the supplied delivery method included with the request.

As with all authentication policies, the requester's first request will initialize the policy workflow and mechanisms for subsequent authentication verification requests. This is achieved by sending a request to the authentication service API endpoint specifying the required authentication Policy. The policy identifier for MAC OTP is 'urn:ibm:security:authentication:asf:macotp'.

The username parameter may be specified using context attribute reference set by a mapping rule. Alternatively, ensure that the authentication policy requires the user to login before issuing a challenge with this authentication mechanism.

request.doc:
Initialize the MAC OTP authentication policy without a delivery method:
GET https://{runtime_hostname}/mga/sps/apiauthsvc?PolicyId=urn:ibm:security:authentication:asf:macotp
The requester must maintain cookies returned by this API and send them on subsequent requests such as PUT requests to verify credentials
